page.title: 04Industry and Employment
page.content: The exploitation of local coal reserves transformed the 19th century fishing villages of East Wemyss, Buckhaven and Methil into industrial towns experiencing rapid urban growth. The Michael Pit, at one time the largest colliery in Scotlnd, and the docks at Methil were soon the focal points of the communities. Both villages have suffered similar problems of unemployment and decline in the last 20 years as the coal industry contracted. However Buckhaven seems to be approaching the problems more positively, an example of this being the projects they have done and are continueing to do through the Community Program Scheme. The largest project completed to date is St. Michaels House which accommodates a number of small craft workshops with central administration facilities.
